issue.title: Disable assertion by default in JMH tests

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Disable assertion by default in JMH tests, to exclude the noise introduced by assertion.

Modification:

Disable assertion in default constructor of `AbstractMicrobenchmark`, also make existing tests `FastThreadLocalSlowPathBenchmark` and `AdaptiveByteBufAllocatorConcurrentNoCacheBenchmark` aligned with this.

Assertion will always be enabled in package `io.netty.microbench.*`.

Result:

Fixes #14876.

issue.title: JMH: Some jmh-tests may need to be re-evaluated

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
This was unexpected noticed when do the PR https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/14878.

The PR https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/14878 disabled assertion by default for JMH tests, which aligned with the common production settings.

That change may affect some benchmark results, for example, the [ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark](https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/24479a05cd20394d6d393b1ce3037046218158cc/microbench/src/main/java/io/netty/microbench/buffer/ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.java) to compare performance between`PooledByteBufAllocator.DEFAULT` and `adaptiveAllocator`: (with JDK-17, M1 chip, 8 cores, 16G RAM)

Before PR:
```
Benchmark                                                    (size)   Mode  Cnt         Score          Error  Units
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   00064  thrpt   20  86231768.383 ¬± 11380104.655  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   00256  thrpt   20  66344453.516 ¬±  7880299.523  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   01024  thrpt   20  74466000.545 ¬±  2760686.046  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   04096  thrpt   20  62714323.129 ¬± 18474124.550  ops/s

ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     00064  thrpt   20  61425921.135 ¬±  5594520.883  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     00256  thrpt   20  63096846.621 ¬±  4574851.790  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     01024  thrpt   20  56776682.109 ¬±  3068264.099  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     04096  thrpt   20  67311458.665 ¬±   912472.494  ops/s
```

After PR:
```
Benchmark                                                    (size)   Mode  Cnt         Score          Error  Units
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   00064  thrpt   20  82133101.607 ¬±  3019206.156  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   00256  thrpt   20  89869155.325 ¬± 18547254.496  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   01024  thrpt   20  63534329.364 ¬±  1097248.608  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleaseAdaptive   04096  thrpt   20  76226536.182 ¬±  2291379.662  ops/s

ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     00064  thrpt   20  89168684.647 ¬±   524291.239  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     00256  thrpt   20  73949586.496 ¬±   511747.281  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     01024  thrpt   20  73877283.124 ¬±   429980.373  ops/s
ByteBufAllocatorConcurrentBenchmark.allocateReleasePooled     04096  thrpt   20  89362198.398 ¬±   447059.402  ops/s
```

As we can see, the performance of `PooledByteBufAllocator.DEFAULT` improved(+15% ~ +45%) after the PR, and its performance numbers become compatible with `adaptiveAllocator` after the PR.

There might be other jmh-tests need to be re-evaluated. 

This is more like a gentle reminder/discussion rather than an issue, so feel free to close it.
